column1: slips it down leg, off the bat. Races to the fine leg boundary. Easy runs first up. A dream delivery you want as an opener first ball.
much better. Bowls this full, just around off, Brathwaite jabs this away from the crease
dabs this from the crease into the off side.

leg-stump half-volley and Brathwaite's balance is superb as he flicks this to the square leg boundary. Not much swing here either. This is just a delicious delivery for any batsman to miss out. Got to do better than that in the first over.
short of length delivery way outside off, left alone. Good carry through to Rishabh Pant
short of length outside off, watched through to the keeper again.
too full and far too wide outside off to get the batsman playing, Powell is happy to leave. Not an ideal first delivery.
much better, slants this at length across the left-hander. Left alone

excellent delivery this time. Plugging away at length across the left-hander, this is much closer to the stumps. Powell wants to play initially but lets it go at the last moment. Not much swing again, this one held its line.
punches this length delivery to Ashwin at mid-on, nice timing, nice touch.
length ball on the pads, tucked to fine leg to get off the mark
much fuller and just around off, defended from the crease.
punches this length ball back past the bowler, they jog back for the second. Nice, high elbow as he just played an extension of a forward defence
good delivery, just a touch full and angling across at decent pace. Powell leaves, Pant collects it in front of his face.
gentle little dab into the point region, easy single. Pressure off if you concede singles like those.
stands tall and defends this short of length delivery back towards the bowler.
turns this gently into the leg side, the angle was on middle and leg from wide of the crease.
bat face turns in his hand as he fends this into the leg side.
length ball on the stumps, hint of inward movement off the deck, Powell defends to get an inside edge towards square leg.

induces the edge as Powell jabs this with hard hands, beats gully and races to the third man boundary. Good effort by Prithvi Shaw, gave it chase right till the end and then put out a dive just as it was about to cross the boundary. Couldn't pull it back though.
straightens off the seam, defended to mid-on

flashes and this just eludes backward point. Prithvi needed to be seven feet tall to try and have a chance at taking that. As Shardul completed his run-up, he was hobbling too. May have turned his ankle, or so it looked like. He isn't looking very comfortable. Let's hope he's okay. Something to do with his landing, possibly. Physio Patrick Farhart is out to attend to him immediately.
drifts in from around the stumps, Powell gets half a stride in and defends
steps out and blasts this back over the bowler's head. Once bounce to the fence. Excellent use of the feet
back of length outside off, left alone. Good bounce and zip off the deck
nips away off the seam from length around the fifth stump, left alone again.
slants this into middle and leg, tucked nicely towards deep backward square leg. Kuldeep comes around from fine leg to cut that off
works this full delivery from off stump to mid-on, good wrist work.
ducks under this short ball that leaves Pant having to jump to collect it
shovels this length ball on off stump towards the short midwicket region.
floater on off, swerves in late, defended.
touch shorter, punches this back to Ashwin
in-drifter from outside off, angles back in. Powell is fully forward in defence
pushed through quicker, Powell forces him to defend off the backfoot

slides back in, Powell played down the wrong line and was struck in front of middle, but in doing so, he also got a big inside edge. That he went up for a review immediately must have been a giveaway. Powell survives after being given out
touch full on off, he gets half a stride in and blocks.
back of length delivery outside off, defended from the crease.
Brathwaite takes a step across and defends this incoming delivery into the leg side.
solid in defence again, length on the shorter side.
back of length delivery outside off, left alone.
slants in a full delivery outside off from wide of the crease, left alone.
squared up by the length but ends up defending this from the crease with soft hands.
tucks this wide of midwicket for an easy single
defended back to the bowler, on the shorter side by Ashwin
nice flight, plenty of revs. But this is landed outside off, left alone.
flatter one on the stumps, defended comfortably.
draws him forward with the flight, eased to mid-off.
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery nicely.
driven firmly towards mid-off.
gets half a stride in and punches this length delivery to extra cover
thick outside edge on this drive, races between gully and point to the third man boundary. He was on the move when he made contact. Played away from the body. Lucky to get away with it this time
right on top of the bounce as he fends this short ball angling in.

cracking delivery from Umesh. Full, furiously fast and veering in late towards the base of middle. Powell is surprised by the face and is thrown off gear by the length. Somehow manages to jam his bat down in time to keep it out.
finishes the over with the bouncer that is comfortably avoided.
has he tickled this down leg? Huge appeal but has been turned down by Bruce Oxenford and India don't review. This was drifting down leg, Brathwaite was looking to turn this fine.
this one skids through off a length outside off, left alone
nice flight to draw him forward, Brathwaite smothers this nicely.
tossed up outside off, Brathwaite lunges forward and defends back
on the shorter side, enough time to defend this gently into the leg side.
full on the stumps, blocked.
slants a full ball on the stumps from round the wicket, driven firmly to mid-off
worked off his pads to Jadeja at fine leg
back of length outside off, takes off from a particular spot and shoots up. Excellent leave
right behind the line as he defends this length ball coming in.
short outside off, he ducks under it
full on middle and leg, defended with soft hands to mid-on.

what have you done, Powell? This is clever bowling from Ashwin, but you've got to say Powell has given his wicket away on a platter. Stepped out to go over the top, Ashwin saw him coming and shortened his length and bowled it a touch wide, he reached out to go inside-out but ended up chipping it straight to Jadeja at the end of the ring at cover.
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends this shortish delivery
lunges forward and works this with the spin into the leg side. Didn't get to the pitch even though he was well forward
right forward as he keeps out this flighted delivery.
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers it.
this is a quicker one on the stumps from wide of the crease, eased back towards the bowler.
tossed up and drifting across, worked to short midwicket
slides one across, Brathwaite dabs it gently into the off side as they scamper a single
squeezes this drive back to the bowler. Got too close to the delivery.
googly but got right to the pitch as he squeezed it back to the bowler.
crunching cover drive, delightfully done. Stylish as well. Got right to the pitch to smother the spin and then eased it into the gap. Positive
tossed up on the stumps, he gets a long way forward and defends back.
works this firmly to short midwicket where Kohli puts his left hand out to stop
shortens his length and spins this back in, Brathwaite defends from the crease
slower through the air, Brathwaite gets fully forward and blocks.
fired in at a length on off stump, defended from the crease
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this
excellent leave, gets this to dip and spin from outside off.
edged but lands short of Rahane at slip. This slides across, Hope played for the turn when there was none. Didn't pick it.
turned wide of square leg for a quick single
uppish but safe, doesn't carry to square leg.
works this off the pad towards deep midwicket. Too full from Kuldeep
superb stroke! This is a very good stop by Ashwin at mid-off too. Hope got right to the pitch, read the googly, opened the face of the bat slightly to play it back down the ground.
waits for the turn and defends this googly wide of short leg.
goes on the back foot to defend into the leg side
flatter on the stumps, a touch short, defended with soft hands
stays back to a length ball turning into the stumps, defends with the spin into the on side
a touch straighter still and this turns sharply, down leg. Goes back to work it leg side and can only manage a bit of pad into the fine leg region
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
flat and quite full outside off, stretches out and defends into the on side
floated up slow and full, leg-stumpish line, clipped to the right of forward square leg
full-toss on leg stump, whipped towards mid-on, who's stationed deep enough to allow a comfortable single
nice flight outside off, draws Brathwaite forward to drive against the turn, towards mid-off
stays on the back foot this time, pitches just outside off on a good length. Not too much turn or zip off the surface and he defends comfortably into the on side
very full outside off, fuller than half-volley length, ends up digging it back towards the bowler while attempting to drive into the covers
flatter and quicker, slanted across to a fifth-stump line. Brathwaite leaves it alone
flat, angling down leg, clipped to backward square leg
tossed up slower now, just outside off. Nice stride forward to block it back down the pitch
nice flight again, pitched fairly full on middle stump, defended to short midwicket
full on off stump, driven with the full face showing, to the left of mid-on, where Rahul puts in a full-length dive to stop the ball
nice length, dangled up and then it spins from off to leg. Gets forward but not quite to the pitch, defends to short midwicket
flights it temptingly wide of off stump, Brathwaite ignores the bait
flatter and fuller on the stumps, defended back
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery.
driven firmly to extra cover.
this is drifting away, even though the length is much fuller, Hope solid in defence
driven inside-out to extra cover, got right to the pitch in smothering the turn
wrong'un that he has to lunge a long way forward to jab, he does that quite nicely.
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends back
defends this indrifter from the crease with soft hands
this one is steered wide of slip, straight to short third man
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, defended gently towards short leg
takes a step outside the line of the stumps and defends.
tossed up on the stumps, Brathwaite is half-forward as he defends.
tossed up on the stumps, Hope is a long way forward as he smothers this.
steps down the pitch and works this with the spin to long-on.
looks to step out but can't get to the pitch, ends up jabbing it wide of short leg.
slider that is a touch short on the stumps, punched back.
steps out to go over the top, but doesn't get the elevation, Kuldeep stops.
right back into the crease as he turns this gently into the leg side.
slides one across the stumps, defended back
goes right back and across as he defends this with soft hands
driven firmly with the angle to mid-off. This one drifted away, he got right to the pitch of the delivery.
sharp turn and bounce from length just outside off, Hope is across in trying to nurdle that but this one hit the back pad. Impact outside off.
gets a long way forward and smothers this
works this with the spin to mid-on
steps out and drills this down towards mid-on where the substitute fielder Hanuma Vihari slides around to stop it.

this is a half-tracker that sent Prithvi Shaw at short leg into a tizzy. Even before the ball arrived, he had his backs to the batsman. Hope picked the length early, swivelled back and hammered the pull to the square leg boundary
gets a long way forward and eases this with the spin to wide long-on
doesn't carry to Rahane at slip again! There's no fizz on the delivery, just drifts across. Brathwaite jabbed at it to get the thick edge.

beautiful delivery from Kuldeep. This is the sidespin, plenty of revs. Lands on a length on off and spins back in to beat the inside edge. So the only question then is if this would've gone on to miss the stumps. Even just clipping is fine because the onfield decision is out. Hawkeye shows this would've hit middle and off, and West Indies have not just lost their most solid batsman but also a review. A wicket well deserved for Kuldeep.
googly but the length is shorter, so there's bounce. Defended from the crease.
drifts one across the right hander, Hope is well forward as he smothers this.
goes right back into the crease and nudges this into the leg side
on the stumps, around length, defended back.
lovely from Ashwin. Nice flight and dip on the delivery as Hope steps out to get to the pitch and drives to mid-off
flatter one on a length, Hetmyer is right back into the crease as he pats back
squared up a hint by the turn but defended back nonetheless.
stopped nicely by Prithvi at short leg. Moved instinctively as the batsman lunged to work this to the leg side.
jabs this googly with his bat well in front of the pad.
works this from a length on middle and leg to deep midwicket
drawn forward by the flight, defended with soft hands.
shapes to cut but this pitches short and fizzes through to beat the underedge. Kept really low

not sure what he's trying to do. An ugly hoick across the line, but gets away as he slices this wide of point. Got out that way in the second innings at Rajkot. Not so clever from someone who is touted as the next big batting hope from the Caribbean.
slips this in full, hint of reverse back in, worked with the angle towards midwicket.
stands tall and punches this short of length delivery into the gap at mid-off for a quick single.
superb delivery. Fizzes through off a length, Hetmyer plays inside the line and sees this zip through to the keeper.
angles in from a length and keeps a touch low to roll to slips off the toe-end. Hetmyer was deep inside his crease trying to evade a short ball.
back of length outside off, hint of nip back in off the seam, left alone

this is a beautiful, freeflowing drive that will ease some nerves. Not all that bad a length, but there's not much off the deck for the batsman to fear the edge, so brings out his front foot and hits through extra cover fearlessly.
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends this legbreak with soft hands.
drifts away and gets some skid off the pitch. Hope is right across as he jabs forward
steps out and fetches this from off stump towards short midwicket
right on top of the bounce as he works this gently towards deep midwicket
drifts in and goes straight on, Hetmyer gets an inside edge onto the pad as he plays for the turn.
good stride in as he smothers this tossed up delivery.
length delivery on off stump from wide of the crease, he hops back and defends.
floats this just a touch ahead of length outside off, left alone
stands tall and punches this short of length delivery to the point boundary. Shot of the morning! Picked the length early, transferred weight back and picked the gap
hint of movement back in off a length from outside off, he drops it into the leg side with soft hands.
lands this on a length around middle, defended back.
shows the full face of the bat and drives to mid-off.
firm drive but can't pick the gap. Straight to cover
fired in full and flat, driven to mid-on
squeezes the drive to mid-on, he was a couple of steps forward when he decided to take the run. Ashwin at mid-on fires wayward throw at the bowler's end and there's no one backing up. Five overthrows
rocks back and punches this into the gap at extra cover. Once he picked the gap inside the ring, there was no stopping that. Hetmyer picked the length early and made room to create width.
squeezes this full delivery back to Jadeja
right to the pitch of the ball as he smothers this.
back of length delivery outside off, left alone.
stands tall and punches this length ball into the gap between cover and point. All class and elegance. Delightful to say the least
slants this on a length closer to the stumps, defended back
off balance as he works this full delivery with the angle to square leg, wanted a single but is sent back
good pace, bounce and carry off a length outside off, left alone.

beautiful bowling, gets this to jag back in off the seam to beat Hope's forward prod. The ball hit him on the flap of the pad. The decision comes back as umpire's call, with Hawkeye showing the ball was just clipping middle. India don't lose the review though.
goes right back into the crease and defends this shortish delivery.
angled in towards off from wide of the crease, Hetmyer lunges forward and smothers this
late on the sweep as Jadeja fires it in, deflects off the pad past short fine leg, two leg byes.
sharp turn from length outside off, defended back
slows it down, gets plenty of revs as he lands it at a length outside off, defended
gets this to skid through off a length on off stump, Hetmyer is right back inside the crease as he defends.
late reverse back in from a length, Hope defends with his bat close to the pad.

just a gentle forward press as he laces this length delivery into the gap between cover and mid-off. Superb timing, even better placement. Very nice from Hope, leaning into the shot, weight fully forward and all

once again Umesh's skid beats him for pace, but Hope his hit above the knee roll. Also the angle - sliding into middle from wide of the crease - seems a little exaggerated, and hawkeye shows this would've crashed into leg stump. No time is a good time to lose a wicket, last over before lunch even more so. Hope will be mighty disappointed, but this wicket was coming, Umesh was getting it to veer back in and kept troubling the batsman around the front pad with late movement. Hope has thrown it away after looking extremely solid.
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, Ambris gets right behind it and blocks it away to short midwicket's left
pitched up and holds its line just a shade outside off, Ambris presses forward and defends to the covers
shorter and zipping through outside off, no shot from Ambris
full, starts on off, and spins away, safely defended to silly point
much shorter and breaking away outside off, gets back and jabs it away to the covers
lobs a middle-stump full-toss which is bunted away to mid-on running in
Hetmyer dares to use his feet, smothers this full ball on middle
very full and straight, driven away just wide of Vihari, the sub, at mid-on for a single
full and sliding across off from over the stumps, Ambris hangs his bat inside the line and is beaten on the outside
short and this keeps coming in with the angle, Hetmyer blocks off the back foot
much fuller and largely holds its line on off stump, Hetmyer presses forward and taps it defensively to cover
full and veering into the pads, he plays around his front pad, flicking the ball away to midwicket
back of a length and slanting in at off, hits the splice and rolls away to the leg side
in-between length, finishes on the hips, happily picked off through square leg off the back foot
full and straight, Ambris shuffles across off a touch, and a whirl of those wrists sends the ball away behind square on the leg side. Fine way to get off the mark

What have you done, Hetmyer? He does not read the variation - wrong'un - and simply pads up to it and wears it on his front pad, thinking it was Kuldeep's stock ball that would have broke away from him. Impact may have been outside off (actually ball-tracking returns umpire's call) but it does not matter, as the batsman did not offer a shot. It would have crashed into middle. Second wicket for Kuldeep and West Indies are four down
pitched up and outside off, driven to the covers
fired on off, driven back to him
tossed on a fourth-stump line, blocked off the front foot
skidder on off, Chase ventures deep in the crease and shovels it away with the bottom hand to deep midwicket
straighter one outside off, dead-batted away

Kuldeep in the thick of action, again, this time he nails a direct hit at the striker's end. The TV umpire has been called in. Pitched up and just a shade outside off, tapped to the covers, Kuldeep swoops down on the ball and smashes the stumps, but Ambris is in
back of a length and outside off, Ambris gets on top of it and punchily plays up to Kuldeep
overpitched on off, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
veering into the pads, too full, tucked away behind square. Jadeja chases it hard, as he always does, and tracks it down
full and straight, closes the face and knocks it wide of midwicket
wide of the crease, angling in, swinging into the pads, but the length is just too full. Whipped away behind square for four
lobbed up and breaks away outside off - googly - Ambris does not read it. He closes the face and scoops a leading edge to the left of the bowler
back of a length and spins back into the hips, tucked away to square leg
shorter and outside off, Ambris goes back and works it away to the leg side
tossed up outside off, much fuller, dead-batted away
Kuldeep hangs it up outside off, it drops down, and meets a dead bat
Umesh dives forward from square leg... but it did not carry to him. Flatter and faster on leg stump, Kuldeep finds some bounce as well to mess with Ambris' sweep. He plops a top edge and gets away
Ambris rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and plays it to point
Umesh strays down leg, short, glanced away very fine for four. As easy as eating a sandwich
banged in short and down leg, a bit too quick for Ambris, who does not connect with a pull, swivelling on the back foot
back of a length and angling into a flick to short midwicket
another lifter, this is fired outside off, beats the hook, again
clipped off the pads through midwicket
pushed through outside off, knocked to the leg side off the front foot
floated up outside off, Ambris uses his feet, he likes to go after the bowlers, much like Blackwood. He does not meet the pitch and instead drags it off the inside half to the right of mid-on
pushed through and attacking the stumps, defended
dragged down on middle, ventures back and slugs a pull to square leg

this was coming, wasn't? Kuldeep lobs it up around off or just outside, dares Ambris to go over the top again. This looks like a wrong'un. Yes, the variation. Ambris closes the face and chips a leading edge to Jadeja at cover
back of a length and spins back in, blocked on off stump
full and just a shade outside off, defended back
fired outside off, pushed to the covers
on a length and holds its line outside off, defended
back of a length and skids in, forward and tapped to mid-on
arm ball, slides in on middle, blocked off the front foot to the leg side
dangled up slower and outside off, drilled through the line to the covers
full and outside off, tossed up, driven away to mid-off off the front foot
flighted on off, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
lobbed up outside off, Dowrich stretches forward, gets close to the pitch, and drives it crisply straight of mid-off for four
speared into the pads, tucked away to backward square leg
stock ball, on off, defended to the covers
tossed up on middle, played back to the bowler off the front foot
full and on off, Chase stretches forward in defence
sliding into the pads, clipped to square leg
shorter and breaks back in, punched off the back foot to the covers
tossed up on middle, drifting in, Chase goes over the top. Muscled over midwicket. It did not turn to bother Chase
full and angling in on middle, dragged to mid-on off the inside half
good length and veering in on middle, kept out
Dowrich shapes to sweep, Kuldeep spots it and spears a non-turner on off, jabbed back to him in the end
shorter and breaks away - googly - the batsman reads it off the pitch and has ample time to shift back and crack it through the covers
floated up slower and higher, dips on off, defended off the front foot
shorter and outside off, punched through the line to the covers off the back foot
good length and on off, defended back
tossed on a fourth-stump line, forward and smothered to round out the over
short and slides in on middle, punched away to Jadeja's right
short and wide outside off, Chase sizes it up, and flays it on the up through the cover-point region. Stepped back and cracked it away
still short, dared on the pads, clipped away behind square on the leg side
full and outside off, driven through the line
tossed wide outside off, Dowrich stretches out and ventures an aerial drive but wide of cover
slides on outside off, no shot
Kuldeep strays on the pads of Chase, tucked away with the turn fine for four. The man in the deep is square
pushed through on middle, Chase uses his reach and knocks it away to midwicket
flat on middle, stretches out and drives down the ground to mid-on
tossed up outside off, Chase steers it to point
back of a length and skids back in, Chase goes on the back foot and punches to mid-on again
full and outside off, forward and driven firmly to cover
full and outside off, driven away for one
good length and outside off, blocked off the front foot
overpitched and outside off, Chase stays leg-side of the ball and simply clatters it through the covers. Bam!
full and angling into a front-foot defence back to Jadeja
back of a length and skidding in, defended back down the pitch
dragged shorter and outside off, chopped away to backward point
nice and full outside off, Dowrich leans into it, gets close to the pitch, and laces a drive through the covers
short and spins back in, worked with the spin through square leg off the back foot
darted on the hips, swatted away to deep square off the back foot
shorter and outside off, rides the bounce and clips it away to deep midwicket
dangled up outside off, Chase presses forward and drives to Kuldeep's left to mid-off
short and spins back in, Chase lets the ball slide off the face through the point region
on a length and spins in, defended
much fuller on off, defended
full on the stumps, no much turn, tapped to midwicket
good length and turning into the pads, glanced away behind square
full and holds its line outside off, Dowrich plays a fair way away from the body and pokes the ball to point
shorter and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and forces it to backward point
back of a length and outside off, chopped away to the covers
looped up on off, defended to the covers off the front foot
back of a length and spins in, some bounce to boot, defended to short leg
tosses a full-toss on middle, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length, pitches on leg stump, and rips away just outside off, this googly is somehow diffused to slip
back of a length and attacking the stumps, the batsman covers up in defence
nice and full outside off, Chase deploys his long reach and drives the ball to mid-off
slider on middle, knocked away to the right of the bowler
flighted on middle, Chase miscues a drive to mid-on
looks like the arm ball, skids on middle, jabbed away to midwicket
fired on off, the length is short and spins in, chopped hastily to point
on a length on middle, driven to the right of mid-on and Chase hares across for a single
full and on off stump, Chase blocks it back to Kuldeep off the front foot
shorter and outside off, rides the bounce and punches square through point
flatter on middle, defended back
full on middle, forward and driven down to mid-off
floated up on off, he drops the ball to cover off the front foot
shorter and outside off, flashed away to point off the back foot
tucked off the pads to long leg
full and outside off, tapped away to the covers off the front foot
flighted on off, played back to Ashwin
darted outside off, no shot
full and turns in on off, blocked back to Ashwin
Ashwin tosses it up further and goes too full and outside off, this half-volley is belted through the covers for four
tossed outside off, Chase backs away outside leg and thrashes it to mid-off
back of a length and angling in at off stump, blocked back
full and hint of turn away outside off, sliced away to point
back of a length on off, jabbed to point
full and slides in on middle, defended back off the front foot
much fuller and outside off, eased to sweeper cover for one
full on middle, dips and turns from around the wicket, prodded past slip
full and on off, smothered off the front foot
flatter and faster on off, driven down to mid-off
straighter one on middle, dead-batted away
dangled up on leg stump, forward and defended to the covers
full and angling across off, Dowrich comes forward and wedges it to point
on a length and outside off, carved away to the right of backward point. That brings up the fifty stand between Chase and Dowrich
speared outside off, left alone
tossed just a shade outside off, blocked off the front foot
good length and holds its line outside off, ignored again
tossed outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
shorter and outside off, jabbed to the covers
full and outside off, sliced away through the covers
tossed just a shade outside off, defended off the front foot
full on middle, stretches out and drives straight of mid-on
attempted carrom ball, drops it short and wide outside off, Dowrich rocks back and nails a square cut
on a length and turns away, glides it away behind point with an open face
good length and outside off, presses forward and drops the ball to cover
dropped short and wide outside off, slices a cut to backward point
pushed through on off, blocked back to him
floated up on off, forward and defended
darted outside off, no shot
speared on the pads, Chase works it away through square leg
good length on off, pushed back to the bowler
slower through the air on off, played back to the bowler
good length on middle, blocked to Shaw at short mid-on
full and sliding across off, defended to the covers
whipped with the break to midwicket
pushed through on off, blocked off the front foot
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
presses forward and runs the ball to cover-point region
shorter and outside off, whipped away to midwicket
tossed outside off, opens the face and slices it up to short cover
Jadeja lobs it up outside off, Dowrich sizes up the flight, he smokes a six over long-on. Lovely flow of the arms. Clean as soap
short and slanting in at off stump, pushed right back to Umesh, who deflects it back onto the stumps, but Dowrich was in
clipped off the pads through square leg

big appeal for lbw from Umesh, this looks pretty adjacent, but not given by the umpire. Kohli challenges the on-field not-out decision. Full, starts outside off, and reverse-swings back in to catch him on the knee-roll on the front pad. No inside edge or glove. Dowrich plays around his front pad, but is this nipping past leg stump? The tracker suggests it would hit leg stump. So, Umesh returns and provides India with the breakthrough
back of a length and angling in at off, defended back
back of a length and swings in, chipped to short midwicket
bouncer on leg stump, Holder ducks under it
full and sliding into middle, knocked away to mid-on
full and outside off, tapped to the covers
back of a length on the hips, tucked away to deep midwicket
tossed outside off, driven to the covers off the front foot
pitched up on off, presses forward and taps the ball to the covers
darted in on off, blocked off the front foot
short and reverses in at the top of off, Holder covers up in defence
full and swerves in on middle, pushed away to mid-on
back of a length on middle, forced away to the right of mid-on
short and outside off, Holder punches on the up with a high elbow and pings the point boundary. So easy on the eye
short and just a shade outside off, punched back to the bowler
very full on middle and leg, clipped away to midwicket
shorter and outside off, forced through the covers
back of a length and slides in, ticked away fine
drifts in at off, defended off the front foot
back of a length and darted in on off, blocked off the back foot this time
full on the stumps, driven back to Jadeja
back of a length and curving in on middle, defended
short on off, jabbed away to the covers
full and reverses in at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length and veering into the hips, Chase glances a single to long leg and brings up a second successive fifty. His captain Holder embraces him
full and snaking in to catch the pad as he falls over the flick, but this surely heading down leg
Umesh finds reverse-swing again, has Chase falling over the flick this time, but, again this is missing leg stump. Umesh is in the middle of an excellent spell with the old ball
back of a length and darted in on middle, whipped away to midwicket
tossed on middle, eased down to long-off
full on middle, Holder stretches out and plays it back to the bowler
on a length and outside off, jabbed to the covers
full and just a shade outside off, presses forward and drives the ball down to mid-off
Jadeja serves up a half-volley on off stump, Holder stretches out and pings a drive between covers and mid-off to close out the session
width outside off, punched into the gap at deep point as they start with a brace
late reverse back in from wide of the crease, flicked to deep backward square leg
comes back in a long way from outside off, but this is an excellent leave
back of length delivery that jags back in from the fifth stump, left alone.
full, veering in late towards middle, defended with soft hands.
right on top of the bounce as he pats this into the off side.
lunges forward and squeezes this full delivery
full and drifting across the right-hander, defended with soft hands.
touch short and turning in from middle, whipped to deep square leg
spins back in from outside off, Chase is right to the pitch of the ball as he jabs this away

invites the drive by tossing it up, and Chase says 'thank you.' Good stride towards the pitch of the ball, opened the face of the bat ever-so-slightly to pick the gap between cover and mid-off. Beautiful
googly back from over the wicket, defended back towards the bowler.
length ball that reverses back in, Holder looks to punch  but gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
this is cover driving of the highest quality. Umesh overpitches and Holder uses his reach to get to the pitch and lace this through extra cover. Delightful
stands tall and punches this length delivery to extra cover
slips this half-volley on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
gets onto his toes and defends this short of length delivery with soft hands
late movement back into the stumps, Chase turns this gently into the leg side, well aware that there's short midwicket in place for an uppish flick.
sharp turn from outside off, defended back off the back foot

this is superb bowling, and even though he won't get a wicket there's enough fizz to beat Holder. Pitched way outside leg and spun away sharply. Holder is hit high on the back thigh as he completely misjudges the turn. Kohli initially didn't want to go upstairs, he consulted Pant and Rahane. Both of them should have been more assertive in saying that wasn't out. India lose their review
drills this back past the bowler, beautiful flow of the bat to this overpitched delivery
too short and sliding down leg, he looks to pull but is beaten because it was too far down leg
wrong'un but the length is too short, adjusts easily to punch towards midwicket
nice flight, lands this at length on off, Chase waits for the turn and blocks.
late reverse again but slips this down leg, good take by Rishabh Pant
hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square.
angles back in from wide of the crease at length, he stands tall and defends.
off a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket. Looked to punch this on the up
toe-ends a flick to this low full toss that was honing in towards middle.
full toss that he punches back to Umesh. Scoring opportunity missed.
tossed up on off from over the stumps, Chase smothers this nicely.
defends with an opened bat face, but ensures he is right to the pitch of the ball again.
driven nicely, any other fielder at cover and it could've been two, but Jadeja is quick to hare to his left and stop this. Attacked the ball as soon as he made contact
driven against the turn to extra cover
sharp turn but he's well forward in driving this to sweeper cover
breaks back in from outside off, defended with soft hands.
fired full and flat on the stumps, defended back
shortens his length to get this to fizz back in, Holder stabs
dip and turn, Holder checks his drive and gets a thick inside edge to square leg. Nearly defeated by turn
pushed through quicker, lands this just outside off, defended with soft hands
punches to Prithvi Shaw at short mid-on, imaginative field placement that
beauty! That's an Ashwin special. Gets him to lunge forward and play for the turn, only for the ball to slide straight on to beat the edge.
wrong'un but pitched outside leg, enough time to pick it off the pitch and work it towards square leg. An overthrow at the bowler's end gives them a second run
tossed up on leg stump, he gets right forward and smothers it.
first bad shot he's played. Enticed to hoick this but doesn't get under the flight, off a thick inside edge to midwicket
googly but he's well forward, picks it off the hand and defends with soft hands.
this is a superb delivery. A slider that drifts away and skids through to beat Holder's tentative push.
flicks but can't pierce thew gap, straight to Kohli at midwicket
shortens his length, Chase goes back and punches to the bowler.
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers it
carom ball but the length is much shorter, punched to midwicket
gets a long way forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
goes back into the crease and punches it into the gap at cover. Pujara can't prevent the second
gets a good stride in and defends.
drives this full toss straight to extra cover
full and flat on the stumps, Holder is properly forward as he defends.
cracking! Not entirely to the pitch but we through with the stroke and managed to pick the bones out of it
well forward as he defends back to the bowler.
shortens his length and lands this on off stump, defended back
eases this down to long-off for an easy single
short and sliding in, punched to midwicket
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
tossed up and spinning down leg, Holder plays a delicate little tickle to beat short fine. The half-century stand has been raised too.
superb, gets a step outside the line of the stumps and then to the pitch as he laces it into the gap at extra cover
dabs this with an angled bat to short third man.
too short and punished. Holder punches this into the gap at deep cover
drifts in and spins away but Holder is solid in defence
gets half a stride in and covers the line as he defends.
driven with the spin to sweeper cover as they jog the single
drills this drive but straight to Kohli at extra cover.
drifting into middle at length, defended from the crease to the off side.
first instinct is to get as close to the pitch of the ball as possible, does that well as he eases it with the spin to sweeper cover
flighted delivery on the stumps, worked to short midwicket
drifting into the pads, sharp turn from the rough. Chase looks to flick but is beaten by the turn. Even keeper the leg slip can't stop that. Four byes, useful runs from West Indies' point of view.
turns this quietly to deep square leg for an easy single
right forward as he squirts this to the off side.
turns this with the spin to long-on, too easy and extremely sensible
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks.
drifts into middle, whips this into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket
squeezes the drive to Jadeja
defends with the bat well in front of the pad.
superb from Jadeja. Slowed it down, gave plenty of revs on this. Holder wasn't sure if this was going to turn to straighten from the rough, shouldered arms. Knew he'd made a mistake
drifting into middle and leg, worked to mid-on
gets some fizz onto this length ball, hurries Holder onto his backfoot defensive
length on middle and leg, punched to midwicket
flatter on the stumps, defended back
slows it down nicely but Chase gets to the pitch and punches this down to long-on
chips this in the air, shouts of catch but this rolls safely towards deep midwicket.
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the spin to wide long-on
right forward as he smothers this back
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
too short and drifting into the pads, whipped into the gap at deep midwicket
jabs this away with the bat well in front of the pad
drifting in and full on the stumps, defended back to the bowler.
right back into the crease as he punches to mid-on, Rahul a little late to pick it
driven with the spin to Prithvi Shaw at the edge of the ring at cover.
good-length offbreak, turns in, defended off the back foot
tossed on middle, Chase works it away to the leg side
full and on middle and leg, Chase presses forward and drops the ball to short midwicket's right
clipped off the hips to fine leg
looks like a carrom ball, back of a length on middle, played back
full and breaks in on middle, dabbed to the midwicket region
nice and full, slides in on middle, defended back to Jadeja
shorter on middle stump, allows Chase to skip back and force the ball with the wrists through midwicket
full on middle and leg, knocked away behind square on the leg side
overpitched on off, toe-ended away to the covers
good length on off, Chase smothers it off the front foot
darted shorter and outside off, draws a back-foot punch to sweeper cover
floated up on middle, dips, Chase blocks it out
flatter on off, driven to short midwicket
back of a length and spins in towards leg stump, Chase kicks it away with his pad
dropped short and outside off, Chase goes right back - his footwork has been precise - and flays it through the covers like a boss
fuller on middle and leg, here comes the sweep, hit to fine leg
lobbed up on middle and leg, flicked away but can't get it past midwicket
on a length and outside off, drilled away to cover
slower through the air on off, pushed back
fuller and outside off, driven through the line to long-off off the front foot
overpitched and outside off, cracked to sweeper
back of a length and skids in, Chase hastily jabs the ball to the covers
pushed through outside off, laced down to long-off for one
back of a length and reversing in to smack him high on the thigh. It was heading down leg too
short on off, flapped away to short midwicket
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
on a length and outside off, he lets it slide off the face to cover-point region
lifter outside off, ducks under it does Chase
leg-stump half-volley, clipped away to deep square leg
full and outside off, driven to the covers
back of a length on middle, whipped away to deep midwicket
full and outside off, cracked away to the covers off the front foot
on a length and spins away outside off, jabbed to the covers
full on off, defended
full and drifts in on off, wedged to the leg side
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, no movement in the air or off the pitch, defended to cover
back of a length, starts outside off and swings away sharply. Left alone. Pant throws himself to his right and collects the ball in front of first slip. It bobbles out in the end
good length and angling in at off, jammed away to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Holder punches away from the body and sends a thick edge flying to the right of gully to third man
shorter and outside off, gets behind the line in defence
dug in short on off, Holder attacks it with an aerial pull and sends it over midwicket. Holder marks his return with a fine fifty
pitched up and slides on outside off, forward and crisply driven down to long-off
round-arm dart on off stump, blocked off the front foot
on a length and hint of turn outside off, sliced away to point
good length and drifts in just a shade outside off, Holder judges it well and swishes his bat out of the way
fired on off, presses forward and jabs a single to the right of backward point
on a length and outside off, patted to the covers
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, Holder lets the ball slide off the face behind point
back of a length and holds its line on off, punched back to the left of Umesh
bouncer on leg stump, flies through to Pant, as Chase swerves out of the way
short and climbs on the hips, tucked away to square leg

Jadeja (who else?) throws the stumps down. But Holder is in. Shorter and outside off, tipped to the covers, Jadeja moves to his left, swoops down on the ball, and hits the stumps but Holder gets across in time

Holder has been strangled down the leg side. Banged in short and down leg, Holder is a bit late to adjust to the line. He gloves it behind to Pant. Umesh strikes, this time with the second new ball. Holder didn't really wait for the umpire's decision. He had started walking, says Al Muthu from Hyderabad
half-tracker on middle, but shoots low, Chase goes low with it and short-arms it away past midwicket
floated up on off, Bishoo inches forward and keeps it out
hangs it up outside off, defended from the crease
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
dangled up outside off, Bishoo mis-hits to mid-off
good length, starts outside off, and rips away as Bishoo lets it go
bouncer on the leg stump, Chase sinks under it
Chase rises with this short ball and fends it away to midwicket
Umesh hits a splice-jarring length outside off, Chase hops and fends it to the covers
bouncer on middle, ducks under it now
back of a length and outside off, jabbed to the covers
nice and full outside off, driven smoothly to the covers
full-toss on middle, bunted to mid-on
good length and breaks away outside off, as Bishoo jabs and misses
full on middle, defended
pushed through on off, opens the face and runs the ball to the covers
floated full and outside off, eased to the covers
full on the stumps, driven back. First maiden since the 40th over
full and darted straight, worked to midwicket
full and spins in to take the inside edge and roll away behind square on the leg side
on a length and outside off, punched up to the covers
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
looks like a carrom ball on middle and leg, driven to midwicket
fired on off, tapped to the covers
back of a length and spins back in at off, punched down to long-off for one
googly, spins back in, inside-edged away behind square
dipping full-toss, Chase jams it out
on a length and spins in, popped to the right of short leg
full on middle, driven back to the bowler
back of a length and turns in, chipped in the air to Kuldeep's left
movement off the pitch, Chase gets a leading edge wide of point as he tries to work this into the leg side. Moves on to 99
back of length on middle and leg, hurries onto Bishoo who is late on the shot. Hits him on the thigh pad.
back of length delivery angling away, Bishoo defends this gently into the point region.
right behind the line of this length ball as he dabs this into the off side.
tucks this short of length delivery on middle and leg towards square leg

the off stump goes for a walk and Umesh has his fourth. Feeble push away from the body from Bishoo, no feet movement, plays down the wrong line and gets a thick inside edge onto the stumps. This kept a touch low as well and Bishoo should have been playing forward. India strike early.

whips this to midwicket and scampers a single to bring up his fourth Test century! He's so so happy, so are his mates in the dressing room. This has been an excellent knock, a confident knock. Applause from the Indians as well.
touch short and slips this on off stump, defended back
sees the flight and what does he do? Down on one knee as he clobbers this slog over wide long-on. Warrican isn't going to dead defend here.
beaten on the drive by a tossed up delivery that drifts away late.
googly but the length is too short, defended off the backfoot
beaten by a googly that is much fuller in length. He played for the turn and so inside the line.
bowls this full on off stump, keeps a touch low but Chase is confidently forward as he defends
angles in a full delivery on middle from wide of the crease, Chase shows the full face of the bat in defence.

off a thick bottom edge, wide of the keeper and between the slip fielder. Loose attempted punch away from the body for four streaky runs to the third man boundary. If you've played as well as Chase has, you deserve some luck. Bounce again much lower than the batsman anticipated.
back of length and moving away from the fifth stump, left alone.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
ducks under this short ball outside off quite comfortably.
gets well forward and drives to mid-off for a quick single. Mohammad Siraj, the substitute fielder, a little slow to move. Excellent response from Chase to his partner's call.
crunching drive to mid-off, this time the single is nice and easy.
works this with the spin towards the bowler.
rapped on the pad as he shapes to sweep, but this legbreak pitched outside leg.
punches this into the gap at midwicket for an easy single this time, Kohli the fielder.
right back into the crease as he defends this shortish delivery.
full and swinging away from off stump, driven firmly to cover point
beauty! Moves away late off a length to square the batsman up. Zips through to the keeper.
gets half a stride forward and defends this length delivery into the off side.
bunts this away with soft hands from the crease.
shows the full face of the bat to defend this length ball angling in.
too short and way over his head, ducks under this.
tossed up on middle, Chase is a long way forward as he smothers this.
works this with the spin to wide long-on, once again a good stride forward
slips this length ball on off stump, breaks back in a touch. Defended from the crease.
goes for a wild slog across the line but is beaten by the googly that lands outside off and moves away further.
drifts away at a length on off stump, defended back.
driven again, but straight to KL Rahul at cover.
back of length on off, defended from the crease.
excellent carry to the keeper. Bowls this length ball on a fifth-stump line outside off, left alone.

the stumps have been rattled and Umesh has a five-for. This is a magnificent delivery to get the centurion. This was full, moved in a hint off the seam on middle and beat Chase's forward push to sneak past the inside edge and shatter the stumps. Umesh becomes only the third Indian fast bowler to take a five-for at home since 2010.

he finishes with six and West Indies are all out. These are Umesh's career-best figures, what a return. This is full and moving away off the seam from outside off, Gabriel plays a loose drive, gets a thin edge that is gleefully accepted by Rishabh Pant.
off the mark with a crunching drive through extra cover. It was a juicy half-volley and Rahul was ready, fine drive, nice followthrough
punchy drive on the up but straight to Chase at point

bangs in an effort delivery towards Shaw's body, he awkwardly fends this away. The ball skid through and thudded into the top part of his bat. Shaw had to take his right hand off the grip, but it was a touch too late by the time he did. That's more like it, good to see from Gabriel
beautiful. He is very very strong square of the wicket on the off side. Drops short, there's width and Shaw gets right onto his toes to punch this behind point. Very nicely executed.
slashed over the slips, and this goes all the way over the third man boundary. Huge no-ball from Gabriel. Heard the call early and just went for it.
solid, confident push to cover this time.
driven back past the bowler, mid-on comes around to stop. Expensive first over. India up and away.
slips this full delivery down the leg side, through to Dowrich as Shaw misses the flick
full and swinging away from off stump, shows the full face of the bat in defence
defended back towards the bowler again with soft hands.
no-ball, a streaky poke from Shaw and this races between slips and the gully region. This is a very poor start from West Indies.
slips a full delivery down leg, Shaw hit on the pad as he is late on this flick shot.
hops back and gets on top of the bounce to defend this short of length delivery back towards the bowler.
opens the face of the bat to punch this shortish delivery to point
comes back in sharply off the seam from outside off, this is an excellent leave from Rahul
drives but the ball comes back in a long way to roll to mid-on off an inside edge.
zippy back of length delivery outside off, left alone.
once again wants to drive but this one veers in to take the inside edge and roll back towards the bowler. Was reaching out to drive again with his foot nowhere near the pitch of the ball.
full just around off stump, left alone. This keeps so low that Dowrich is hit flush on his left knee-cap as this deflects to the boundary. Dowrich in considerable pain. They'll also take drinks.
solid forward defence to a full delivery.

this is a beautiful cover drive. Full and swinging away to make it a juicy half-volley and Shaw was ready. Free-flowing drive to beat the infield. This boy will score runs quickly, play shots if the ball is in his zone. Lovely to see this approach
delicious off-drive that races past this billiards top outfield, good stop by the mid-on fielder running across. Bishoo with a sliding stop but they'll take just two. Could have taken three
shortens his length and angles it in towards the stumps, defended solidly.
once again the drive against the ball that just moves away a hit, good stop at extra cover. Equally impressive footwork by Prithvi in getting a good stride forward while driving.
on dear, the substitute keeper has just let this full delivery burst through his gloves. The captain isn't going to be pleased with that. Shaw looking to tickle it fine but missed it too.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
sharp inward movement from length outside off, left alone.
another poor delivery down leg, the keeper can't do much this time despite a full stretch dive to his left. Four runs behind the wicket. Crime to be bowling like that, really. Poor from Gabriel
big inside edge onto the pad as Rahul goes for a booming drive. Once again playing down the wrong line, could've so easily inside-edged that onto his stumps.
right forward as he smells leather in defending this under his nose.
works this with the angle towards midwicket for an easy single
whipped away to the square leg boundary. Length ball sliding into the pads isn't going to worry Shaw. Uppish and executed disdainfully.
driven with the spin to mid-off
pushed through quicker, much fuller as well. Rahul skips out and eases this to cover
drifts in a full delivery on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
defended with the spin towards mid-off
wrists this full delivery from off stump towards mid-on
squeezes this attempted whip to mid-on. Was looking to play this more towards midwicket.
punched into the gap at point, doesn't take the run as Chase is swift to move to his left.
nips back in off the seam from length outside off, defended back down the pitch
delightful balance and poise as he puts away this leg-stump half-volley to the midwicket boundary. Easy pickings.
full and shapes away from off stump, Shaw check-drives this into the gap for a single
confident forward stride as he defends this away-going length delivery. Another no-ball, the struggle continues for Holder.
angles in a length delivery on the stumps, defended back.
late on an attempted flick, hit on the pad but the angle was taking the ball down the leg side.
gets right to the pitch of the ball and drives to mid-off

slog-swept with the angle to the midwicket fence. Not afraid to play across the line even if he had to fetch it a little from outside off. What worked to his favour there was the length. It was too full and he got right underneath the flight. What confidence

this is a classy drive, even if not entirely to the pitch of the ball. Unfurled his wrists nicely to hit this to the left of the cover fielder. Superb, hitting on the up without any inhibitions. The confidence - remarkable.
the mid-off fielder lets this through his legs to give Shaw his third four on the trot. Too full, Shaw clears his front let and drills this drive. He's raced into the 40s
drifts one into middle, Shaw lunges forward and blocks with soft hands.
once again tight defence to one that drifts in towards middle.
slashes this wide delivery, beaten. Looked to go over point
back of length delivery that moves away off the seam from outside off, left alone.
floats this full and much closer the stumps, defended back.

he's dragged this back onto the stumps. Uncertainty in his decision-making again, wanted to leave, then jabs at this length ball that moves away and sees the ball bounce back onto the stumps. Rahul's was a tortured existence, never looked comfortable. Both times the late movement has done him in. India lose their first half an hour before lunch.
slips this down leg, searching for late swing but there's none this time. The keeper stumbles but collects by moving to his left.
gets half a stride forward and stabs this away.
drifts in this short ball on middle, punched back.
drills this extra cover drive to sweeper cover
drifts in a full delivery on off stump from wide of the crease, defended back
steps out and whips this wide of midwicket for a quick single
whips this delivery from outside off towards mid-on
gets a good stride forward and smothers this nicely.
plays outside the line of this length delivery slightly, gets a thick inside edge past square leg.
zippy length delivery on the fifth stump, moves away a touch. Pujara leaves
half-volley outside off, there's an open invitation to drive but Pujara doesn't bite the bait
invites the drive by pitching it up again, Pujara lets it go.
gets this length ball to slant in towards the stumps, solidly defended back to the bowler.
moves away from off stump, watched through to the keeper.

dropped at slip but that's a very difficult chance. Shai Hope, the fielder. Shaw looks for a cut but is cramped for room, flew wide to his left at an awkward height, and he just managed to get his hands onto that. Lucky reprieve
punches this down to long-on as he jogs the single
defends this quicker delivery with a straight bat.
positive footwork, superb use of his feet to get to the ball as he lets his wrists take over and drill this past the bowler. Beats mid-on as well, rocket hit.
sees the batsman stepping out and shortens his length just a touch, Pujara dabs it away.
squeezes the drive back to the bowler, got too close to the ball
driven imperiously but Gabriel puts in a dive running to his left from mid-off to stop that
gets right on top of the bounce and defends this short of length delivery
angles one in onto the stumps, defended back.
short and far too wide outside off to trouble Pujara, left alone.
leaning into the drive, laces this on the up but straight to mid-off
floats this full and invites the drive with two slips in place, left alone.
defended back to the bowler firmly.
punched down to long-on as Prithvi brings up his second fifty plus score in Tests, just his second innings remember.
jabs this indrifter into the off side.
whips this back towards the bowler as he steps across to meet the ball, good stop by Warrican
lucid drive but straight to extra cover
drifts in but slows it down very nicely, Pujara plays it with soft hands.
defended back down the pitch
driven firmly into the gap at mid-off for an easy single
angles in a length delivery on middle from wide of the crease, Pujara jabs this one away as it rolls to the leg side.
right behind the line of this length delivery as he defends back towards the bowler. Tight from Pujara.
full and moving away from off stump, Pujara prods forward and defends with soft hands.
gets as close to the delivery as possible in blunting this incoming delivery.
whips this full delivery down to long-on as he jogs the single
shortens his length and angles it in towards the stumps, blocked.

rocks back, makes room to open up the off side and punches this shortish delivery on the stumps to the cover boundary. Picked the length very early and then transferred weight back. Superb use of the crease there.
steps out and drives with the spin to cover
tossed up on the stumps, Pujara defends with the bat well in front of his pad.
once again angles one in full, Pujara shows the full face of the bat to keep that out. That's lunch on day two.
length ball floated down leg side, flicked out to deep midwicket
another one at leg stump. At a length and pushed through flatter this time. Flicked to short fine leg. It's drifting down leg
length on leg stump, steps out and tickles it to short fine
another length ball drifting down leg side, flicked to short fine
length ball at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket's right
short of a length on middle stump, allows it to turn into the pads and jabs to short fine
...which means a massive gap in the cordon. Which means a boundary opportunity. Shaw takes it. It's a yorker length delivery just outside off. He crouches a touch and guides it through there
full ball slanted into the pads. Stands tall and flicks it to deep square's left
length ball pushed down leg side and past the bat as he looks to flick this
length and in at middle stump. Defended with the full face off the front foot
sweetly driven through cover. Overpitched ball outside off with no movement and he's held a great shape as he gets on the front foot to drive
length and into the pads. Flicked to deep square
short and wide outside off, waits for it to go a touch behind him before cutting to sweeper's left
length and in at leg stump, tapped to midwicket off the front foot
full toss drilled wide of mid-off. That's like a throwdown. On off stump and he puts it away easily

driven straight to extra cover! That's nicely done from Warrican. Gets it to loop and dip this time, at a length outside off and that can often do the trick against aggressive batsmen. Shaw will look to drive in this form. This time, he won't get to the pitch and there's marginal movement away from him off the pitch. He's far away enough as it rises on him to not be able to control that. West Indies will be grateful, he was beginning to run away again
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
full on off stump, blocked into the covers off the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full toss in at middle and leg at 146kph. Mistimed punch to mid-on
yorker in at middle and leg stump. Jams the bat down on this and it pings to mid-off off the leading edge
yorker length and in at the toes. Clips it to deep square's left...and his throw at the non-striker's end is not gathered cleanly. Kohli will get a second
length ball wide outside off, flails at this on the up and gets a thick outside edge to backward point's left. He dives to stop that from going to the boundary

thin edge as he hangs the bat outside off and it carries low to Hamilton behind the stumps. It's a straight ball at a length outside off - no movement really. Pujara normally lets those go. This time he jabs at it and with Gabriel's pace, he's caught inside the line of the ball. A loose stroke and suddenly West Indies have the momentum
length on off stump, punched to extra cover off the front foot

misfield at mid-on and it's four. Full and flat at middle stump from Warrican and Kohli brings out the trademark whip-drive with an angled bat to that fielder's left. It's Bishoo and his dive is slow-mo
length on off stump, blocked off the front foot

full and in at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the front foot

won't let this one go. It's closer outside off, but also fuller than the last one. Crouches into this drive and uses his wrists to caress it through cover. Glorious.
length ball wide outside off, left alone
goes wide of the crease and doesn't land the yorker. It's a full toss on off stump and Kohli taps it to mid-off's left
another full toss. Struggling to land them every time he looks to go full. It's outside off, Rahane shuffles in towards it and taps it past extra cover
thick outside edge as he chases wide outside off. Gabriel gets it on a length this time with a lot of width. Point is on the fence so Rahane survives. Wasn't to the pitch of that

a mix-up and Rahane is lunging at the non-striker's end. It's a full ball on leg stump. Stays in the crease and flicks it through square leg. That is Rahane's call for the second run and he takes a couple of big strides down. Kohli sends him back. A good call in the end, that would've been tight. Warrican doesn't collect the throw behind the stumps either
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off, tapped back towards the bowler
length ball slanted in at leg stump, nudged through midwicket with soft hands

full on middle stump, driven to mid-off with the turn
short of a length just outside off, drops it in front of gully with soft hands

length outside off, tapped into the open cover point region with an open face
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, gets forward and opens the face to run this past gully. Deep backward point cleans up
length ball wide outside off, left alone
leaves an incoming ball but seemed to have picked that. It started at a length outside off and came into the corridor
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
leading edge as he tries to flick from middle stump. That holds in the pitch and doesn't go on with the angle. Trickles harmlessly to mid-off
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
short ball turns away as he shapes for the pull. He has to adjust and guide it to deep square
length ball spinning towards middle from leg. Blocked with the bat in front of pad
full on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler off the front foot
punched wide of mid-on but the fielder runs back to pull that in. This was dropped short at middle stump and he got back to muscle it wide of that fielder

length ball turning away from off stump, defended off the back foot

met on the full again outside off, driven to mid-off's left and an early call to steal the single

full on off stump, nimble feet to get to the pitch but his drive won't beat extra cover to the left

length all wide outside off, pushes away from the body and loses control of this. Forced to open the face and guide towards backward point

full on middle stump, driven firmly to mid-on's left and Bishoo is quickly down to tumble and stop
length ball on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball at leg stump, looks to flick off the back foot but cops this on the front pad
short of a length on middle stump, closes the face and defends to midwicket

overpitched outside off, jammed to extra cover

length ball up at middle stump. Blocked on the front foot

length ball with a flat trajectory, just outside off. Left alone as it turns away

length on middle stump, blocked down the pitch
length outside off, opens the face and runs it to backward point

full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the front foot

short of a length outside off. Gets deep in the crease and chops to sweeper cover. Would've been dangerous if that ball hadn't spun away, was very close to off stump
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, strong wrists as he drives with the turn but extra cover dives to the right to stop that
late on this forward block but manages to get the outside half on it. This spins away from leg stump at a length and his stumps are visible as he plays this
length outside off, opens the face and guides it to backward point
drilled past the non-striker and after a couple of tries, he finally manages to beat mid-on to his left. This was full on middle stump and he got a lot of power through the drive
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven, away from the body to mid-off

thick outside edge but that is very safe as Kohli cuts. It's dropped short outside off and he chucks the bat at it to get it fine of backward point

length on middle stump, makes him watch that closely as he defends in front of off

length ball skids down leg side and catches the front pad as Kohli looks to defend for the turn

given lbw! That looks like it has struck him right in front of middle stump. Kohli reviews. Didn't review immediately so that should rule out inside edge. It looks...quite out. He was looking to close the face on it as it came in from outside off...and it is clipping leg stump. That will remain umpire's call and Kohli is gone. It hit the flap of the front pad. Holder is ecstatic. West Indies back in it once again

outside edge flies between second slip and gully. Reaches out to a wide length ball but with soft hands. It jags away off the surface

length on leg stump, flicked to short  fine's right
mix-up but he gets back in. Length ball on leg stump, defended towards square leg and takes off for a run
short of a length on off stump, punched to the bowler off the back foot
short ball wide outside off, waits late for it and chops it behind square on the off side. That was easy to do, no fielders there

stumping appeal. Pant was beaten in flight after stepping out but seemed to have got his back leg behind the crease after missing this...but first, it's close on the no-ball. Marginally in. But Pant is safe. He was beaten on the outside edge by a dipping length ball that was turning in, but he has managed to get the foot in. Hamilton was a tad slow on that
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, driven handsomely on the up but Gabriel tumbles to his left at mid-off to deny Rahane a boundary
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off

lifts up and gets him on the glove. Short ball rises sharply as Rahane looks to defend. Steeply up at his helmet and he gets the bottom hand off as he looks to defend this. It falls safely in front of the slip cordon
length on off stump, defended down the pitch off the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, Pant stretches forward and leaves
driven with the spin but straight to extra cover
dabs towards the man coming in from point, looks for a single but is sent back
mistimes a drive to short cover. Didn't get to the pitch that time
quicker one on a length outside off, left alone.
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he smothers this tossed up delivery.
length on off stump, steered towards point
floats this full on off stump from wide of the crease, Rahane gets forward and pats it into the off side
driven crisply but straight to extra cover
invites the drive by pitching it up outside off, Rahane doesn't bother playing that

gift of a delivery. Sliding down leg, Rahane plays a delicate little leg glance. Excellent work by Bishoo, running around at least 25 yards to his right and then putting out a sliding stop to pull the ball back in. Rahane should've done better in pinching an extra run
flashy and gets away with this! Reaches out to play an expansive drive but ends up getting a thick outside edge that flies over gully and to the third man boundary.
drifting into middle and off, Pant defends solidly.
angling into middle from around the stumps, he gets forward and defends
sharp turn from outside off, left alone. Hamilton, the substitute keeper, fumbles.
reaches out and then carves it away into the wide long-off boundary. Pant didn't get to the pitch but went through with the stroke. Minimal movement but desired result nonetheless
fired in closer to the stumps, defended back.
whips this indrifter to long-on and jogs the single to keep strike
gets this full delivery to nip back in from outside off, left alone.
plays outside the line to get a thick inside edge onto the pad.
commits himself fully forward as he drives this to extra cover
plants outside the line of the stumps and carefully defends.
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks again.

pushed to mid-off, chances a quick single and is made to scamper real hard at the bowler's end. No sooner than the bat was dragged in, Pant turned around and saw the ball race to the fine leg boundary for overthrows. What should've been one is now five.
cuts well but straight to point.
drifts into middle and leg, plays outside the line to get a thick inside edge into the leg side
shapes to cut but this one skids through on a length outside off, left alone in the end
drills this tossed up delivery to long-off
turns this with the spin towards short midwicket
turn back in from middle and off, Rahane turns this towards short midwicket again.
allows this ball to slide back in to hit his thigh pad. Rolls towards fine leg.
looks to tickle it fine with the angle but he misses it, down through to the keeper.
disdainfully flicked. Too strong there. Holder slips in a leg-stump half-volley and Pant played this uppishly over square leg.
floats this full and across the left-hander, left alone.
bowls full on off stump, Pant smothers this with soft hands.
sharp movement back in from outside off, left alone
nurdles this with the spin to short fine leg.
excellent stop by short midwicket, diving to his left to prevent the run
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the spin towards deep square leg
flatter one on a length from round the wicket, Pant gets well forward and jabs it away.
defends this quicker length ball from the crease.
slider back in towards middle and leg, Pant watchfully defends.
width on offer, Rahane slashes this away to square third man
gets this to straighten off the seam from length outside off, defended from the crease

Dropped! The substitute keeper Hamilton is having a shocking day behind the stumps. The worst part of that? He didn't even look like catching it even though it was a regulation chance. This was short and wide outside off, Pant threw his bat at that to slash, got a thick edge and Hamilton just lunged at it without any footwork. Deflects to third man and Gabriel is livid. Poor from Hamilton
slips this into middle and leg, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, Pant defends confidently.
turns this wide of midwicket for quick single
tight forward defence to a full delivery that angles in.
nice and full on the stumps, Chase consistently manages to land it there. Pant defends.
fired in full on off stump, defended with soft hands.
drifting into middle and leg, worked behind square
rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover, not in control of that stroke.
short and wide outside off, Rahane is happy to leave.
he's taken a flying leap down leg side but this time Gabriel oversteps. Rahane got some gloves on it, did he? Was through with the pull way too early. We'll need replays to confirm.
sways out of the way of this short ball on middle.
shows the full face of the bat as he eases the full delivery down to mid-on
overbalanced as he misses the flick to a length ball angling in, rolls off the pad to square leg.
this one jags back in off the seam from outside off, Pant defends with the angle to the leg side
gets half a stride in as he defends with soft hands to the off side.
gets outside the line of the stumps and softens this one.
steps out but Chase fires this in, Rahane almost yorks himself, somehow manages to squeeze it out.
rocks back and cuts to deep point as he jogs the single
drifts in full from around the stumps, Pant well forward as he blocks.
this is a poor ball, too short, enough width and Pant makes room to crash this into the point boundary. The kind of shot he's been waiting to play
looks to drill it over cover, but gets the toe-end, just lands short of Brathwaite.
steers this back of length delivery to backward point
full on off from wide of the crease, driven gently to mid-off.

this is a very poor ball, a tired ball. Too much width outside off, Rahane blasts this into the gap at deep cover. Superb work in the deep by substitute Keemo Paul, who runs around a good distance before putting in a dive to effect a one-handed stop

gorgeous from Rahane, the shot of a man who is slowly getting back into his groove. Mind you, this is still just an extension of his forward defence but the timing is so very good that mid-on can't get there despite a dive. Straight back down the ground, delightful to watch.
takes him on with the pull this time and times it very nicely. The two men in the deep - fine leg and deep square - converge and two it will be. Jomel Warrican with the stop
gets on top of the bounce and dabs this into the off side.
back in with a full toss, punched to long-on
cut away very nicely, down to deep point.
right back into the crease as he punches this shortish delivery to the off side
short and drifting away from the batsman, Pant opens the face late to steer this past short third man, very nicely executed.

Hetmyer at long-on wasn't sure whether to go for the catch at long-on or prevent the four. In the end, this bounced awkwardly in front of his face and it ended up going to the boundary. Pant clobbered it but didn't get the elevation, can't blame Hetmyer too. Those are difficult chances.
