this is a superb extra cover drive! By no means a half-volley, but it's the confidence that shines through as he plants forward and punches this through the line to bisect cover and mid-off. Beautiful!
floats this close to the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back using a straight bat.
right behind the line of this short of length delivery as he defends.
excellent length delivery that shoots up from a spot outside off, good leave by Rahane
slips this down the leg side, Rahane looks to flick but the angle takes it too far down. Regulation take for Jahar Hamilton.
ouch! Thick inside edge right onto the box. Doesn't show the pain though. Awkward bounce, awkward angle.
defends this incoming length delivery from the crease.
eased into the covers for a comfortable single
slashed away but an instinctive dive to his left by Shai Hope to stop this at gully. Saved a certain boundary
punched on the up to deep point, Rahane has come out with a changed mindset this morning.
shows the full face of the bat as he keeps out this incoming delivery from Gabriel.

extra bounce does the trick, excellent from Holder. Rahane has jabbed this straight to gully and he has to walk back without a century. He was looking to play freely so instinctively went to play this delivery which hit a spot and took off. Rahane got the shoulder of the bat and lobbed straight to Shai Hope. End of a wonderful innings nonetheless. West Indies have the start they were looking for.
what a ball! Swerved back in a long way, hit the turf and then jagged back in further. Jadeja leaves and this shaves past the off stump

given out and Jadeja doesn't bother to review. This is full, once again came back in a long way in the air. Jadeja plays down the wrong line and the ball beats the inside edge to rap him on the pad. Umpire Ian Gould didn't take long to raise his finger. Hawkeye shows this would've hit top of leg. The game is back in the balance, what a dream start this has been for West Indies. Century in the previous game, zero here. Oh, cricket is a leveler, isn't it?
shortens his length, Ashwin sways away from the delivery.

short of length delivery that jags back in to hit the pad as Ashwin plays across the line instead of playing straight. Hawkeye says the angle would've only made it clip the edge of leg stump. Given not out, so it will stay not out.
plays inside the line of this full delivery as it goes through to the keeper.
lifter at length outside off, Pant shoulders arms.
confident push off the front foot to cover.
imperious! Disdainfully flicked to the midwicket fence. Slightly overpitched, Pant's balance and timing superb as he bisected midwicket and mid-on.
banged in short outside off, Pant sways out of the way.
right on top of the bounce as he turns this towards fine leg.
stands tall and punches this short of length delivery to point.
flicked uppishly from outside off towards deep midwicket, good work there to keep it to a single.
slants a length ball into middle from wide of the crease, Ashwin stands tall and bunts it back down the pitch
late swing, the length is much fuller. Driven to mid-on.
off a thick inside edge to square leg to get off the mark. Played down the wrong line, Holder just plugging away by attacking the stumps in search of the lbw
dabs it into the off side, wants the single but is sent back.
right on top of the bounce as he punches this into the off side.
worked off his hip past square leg
defends from the crease, loosened his bottom hand as the ball thudded in.

out in the 90s again! This is an excellent catch by Shimron Hetmyer at cover point. Bounce off the deck from Gabriel, there was width  but not so much that Pant could freely cut. He looked to punch this instead, hit it very well but Hetmyer threw himself to his right and plucked an excellent catch.  The ball was travelling and it needed a very, very good effort to not only get to the ball but also hold on. He fumbled a bit, but luckily for him, the ball got stuck between his hands and ear, then recovered well to complete the catch.
beauty! This is hostile from Gabriel. Fiery angle too, he tries to get besides the line and defend but is beaten
slants a length ball back in, Kuldeep defends back towards the bowler.
disconcerting bounce off a length, Ashwin fends this into the leg side
beauty again from Holder. Nips back in from a length on off stump, Ashwin right behind the line in defence.
gets this to shape away a hint from outside off, punched to cover point.
invites the drive by pitching it up and getting the ball to move away off the seam, excellent leave by Ashwin
worked off his hip into the gap at deep square leg
length ball that holds its line from outside off, left alone.
zips past the shoulder of the bat and was on its way up as the keeper leapt up to grab this. Superb from Gabriel
edged but rolls to gully
beauty! Once again hops back to play besides the line but is beaten for pace, not far from the edge.
plays this with an angled bat as they take a quick single into the covers.
superb wrist work, VVS Laxman style, to fetch this from outside off towards midwicket.
nearly sneaked through the gap between bat and pad. Off a thick inside edge to fine leg.
driven straight to cover as he gets to the pitch of the ball
slower and nicely bowled on middle from wide of the crease, Ashwin lunges forward and smothers it
slides back in from a length, Ashwin defends back
gentle little push into the off side as he gets a good stride in.
hint of turn from a length outside off, punched to cover
driven with the spin to cover again.

squeezes this drive into the gap between cover and point. Gabriel pitched it up to surprise the batsman after a short-ball barrage in the previous over, Kuldeep was ready this time. Must be four because Warrican's back leg touched the skirting as he pulled it back in.
bunted away past short leg, towards wide mid-on. Should've been two, but there's confusion between him and Ashwin. Once again, this was angled full on middle from wide of the crease.
looks for a flash upper cut over point but is beaten by pace and bounce.
excellent work off his hip to deep square. Just whipped it away nonchalantly.
banged in short but this is way over his head, keeper fumbles but collects it on the second attempt
full and angling away, Kuldeep defends
works this from outside off towards short midwicket
slow turn from length on off, defended.
nearly chipped back! Just hung his bat out, checked his shot I thought
driven inside-out to extra cover.
drifts in and nearly yorks himself, Ashwin just about manages to squeeze that out.
superb delivery, drift, dip and turn to take the leading edge, just eludes short cover.
slips in a full delivery, late movement back in. Defended
moves back in from outside off, Kuldeep gets forward and defends.
sucked him into the drive, nearly. This one swung away late to beat the outside edge as Kuldeep looked to drive
slipping down leg, the length ball hits Kuldeep on the thigh pad. Angle and height in question, would've missed the stumps either way.
squeezes this off an angled bat but an excellent stop by Chase at gully, ran to his right and then dived full stretch to save at least a couple of runs
play and a miss, once again poking with an angled bat.
driven with the spin to extra cover.
drifts in on a length, Ashwin gets outside the line of the stumps and pats it gently.
gets right to the pitch of the ball and defends back
width outside off, Ashwin cuts but can't pierce the gap. Straight to point.
goes wide of the crease and tosses it up nicely to draw the batsman forward, Ashwin blocks.
chips down the track and whips this quicker delivery to midwicket
right forward as he defends gently into the off side.
floated full from around the stumps, Kuldeep isn't fully committed to a forward defence but somehow manages to ease it back.
angles back in from outside off to roll off a thick inside edge to midwicket

five wickets for Holder and this is a cracker to get rid of Kuldeep. The off stump cartwheels, and as a fast bowler, you can't ask for a better sight. Lands this at length from round the wicket, jags back in off a length to defeat Kuldeep's tentative push, misses it completely and hears the stumps rattle.
solid forward defence to a length ball angling in from wide of the crease.
defends this length ball on the stumps towards the leg side.
squeezes this uppish drive to point.
eased with the spin to extra cover
drifts in a full ball on middle from wide of the crease, defended back to the bowler.
works this wide of midwicket as Warrican drifts into middle and leg.
firm drive but can't pierce the off side ring, straight to cover.
fired full on the stumps, Umesh gets forward a long way and defends.
full and swinging away from off stump, Ashwin gets forward and defends.
defends gently into the off side again.
steers this wide of point as they scamper a quick single
plays inside the line of this zippy length ball through to the keeper
plays down the wrong line again as this one whizzes through to the keeper.
angles this full on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back.
works this off a length towards mid-on.
steps out and works this from outside off towards square leg.
lunges forward and defends this back towards the bowler.
went for a big mow across the line but played too early. This one dipped and spun away.
fired full on the pads, Umesh works this down towards long-on and jogs the single.
slow turn from outside off, Ashwin check drives to the off side.
inswinging yorker which Umesh manages to keep out somehow to get a single.
right on top of the bounce as he turns this into the leg side.
jumps off a particular spot on length outside off, surprises Ashwin who looks to steer this past gully but is beaten
gets half a stride in as he dabs this into the off side.
thick inside edge, rolls wide of leg stump. Another feeble push from the crease with minimal feet movement.
gentle dab into the off side, looks for a single but can't take it as Chase swoops in quickly from point.
pushed through quicker on middle, Umesh gets forward and defends

slow turn, took a while to get to Umesh as he got a thick edge on the cut, straightforward catch by Hamilton. Umesh looked to smash the cover off the ball. The keeper fumbled but somehow managed to hang on in the end.
drifts in and skids through outside off, left alone.
nice flight, nice loop, Shardul defends from the crease.
eases this back towards the bowler.
off the mark in Test cricket! Slapped into he gap at deep extra cover, but a single is all he'll get when there should've been two normally. Maybe he shouldn't have taken the run.
off a thick inside edge to square leg, feeble push to a length ball that nipped away.
driven to long-off but turns down the run
full on the pats searching for late swing, flicked to midwicket
works this down to long-on, looks for a single but decides against it
stands tall and punches this length ball back to mid-on.
has a big swipe at this but is beaten by late seam movement. Shardul will be on strike.
drifting into the pads, worked with the angle past midwicket
steps out and wrists this on-drive past the bowler for a comfortable single
drifts in but the length is a touch short, enough time to defend from the crease.
goes back and across as he wrists this wide of midwicket
chipped uppishly but into the gap at cover, down to Gabriel in the deep.
shows the full face of the bat in keeping this full delivery out.
slants in a length delivery on off stump, defended.
goes for the hook but is defeated by the pace and bounce, zips past the gloves through to the keeper.
right behind the line as he bunts back
floats this full on off from wide of the crease, driven to extra cover.

cleverly done, looks to sway out of the way initially but then is cramped for room so deliberately opens the bat face to glide this over the cordon to the third man boundary. Used the depth of the crease quite superbly there.
toe-ends a pull, but just evades Hetmyer running across to catch from midwicket. Lucky break for Ashwin, got into a tangle because he was cramped for room.
skids one at length on middle, defended back.
drops short, Ashwin rocks back and pulls into the vacant spaces at deep backward square leg. This is precisely why he wasn't brought in earlier, has the tendency to bowl boundary balls regularly.
gets long way forward and defends with the spin
lunges forward and smothers this quite nicely with soft hands
steps out and punches this to mid-on, risky single because Shardul is hardly able to move, somehow manages to complete the run. This was very casual from Abris, who was caught napping.
rocks back and plays a short-arm jab uppishly towards deep midwicket. Shardul didn't swivel possibly because of discomfort to his groin.
punches this length ball into the vacant spaces at sweeper cover, Warrican comes around to cut it off and Shardul hobbles back for the second with a smile.
shapes to pull but in the end decides to just allow this zippy short ball to slide in and hit the top part of the bat
top-edges the pull and this trickles to the fine leg boundary. Runs flowing, something Holder can't afford. India's lead has now touched 50
sways out of the line of this short ball outside off
comes back in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad as Ashwin looks to work this square
worked off his hip towards deep backward square leg, will keep strike.
lunges forward and defends this gently into the leg side.
drops short, Ashwin punches to long-on but refuses the single
slow turn from length on middle, defended to midwicket
eases this down to long-on, jogs the single this time.
punches this into the gap at point but can't take a single.
too much flight, too full, defended back.
squeezes this one off a thick outside edge to third man.
full toss on the pads, flicked into the gap at midwicket. Hetmyer runs around but can't stop that. He'll pick those away even in his sleep, a rare lose ball from Gabriel.
ohhhooo, bounce from a crack to rap Ashwin on the back hand as he prods forward.

sneaks back into the gap between bat and pad to flatten middle stump. Went wide of the crease and angled this in, moved back off the seam. Ashwin may have been impacted by the knock he took off the previous delivery, so didn't move forward instinctively. Played at this from the crease, just felt for the delivery and played down the wrong line. Dream ball for any fast bowler to see the middle stump knocked back. That will be lunch on day three
vicious outswinging yorker to start off. It's curving away sharply from off stump and he manages to get the thick outside edge off the low part of the bat. It bounces out to gully

is that out? Yes! It's raucous in the stadium and you can barely hear the nick as Brathwaite stabs down leg side at a length ball. It's tickled the inside edge and Pant has gone two-handed with a dive to his left to take this. What a start for India
short of a length in the corridor, jumps away sharply outside off off the seam. Left alone
short of a length in at off stump, zips away off the surface again. He defends watchfully off the outside half
full and wide outside off, left alone
length ball on leg stump, clipped against the angle to midwicket
length ball skids in from outside off, catches him on the thigh guard and drops in front of silly point as he looks to defend
length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone
tossed up at a length and spinning wide outside off, left alone and Pant can't gather cleanly as his feet are static
length ball drifts in  with the seam position. At leg stump. Defended off the back foot
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball swinging away wide outside off, left alone
length ball shaping away outside off. Defended to gully off the outside half
length ball starts outside off, swings away. Left alone
length ball pitching in the corridor, marginal movement away off the seam. The sort of ball that takes the edge if the batsman plays. He doesn't
length ball into the pads, stays nice and balanced as he whips this wide of mid-on on the rise. Stylish first runs
short of a length on leg stump, allows it to come and clips this wide of fine leg off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked to silly point
length outside off, left alone

soft signal is out for a catch at slip. Powell has pushed with hard hands at a length ball turning away from him. Rahane lunges low to his left and takes this from close to the ground. Looks like the two ring fingers are under the ball, but you can't tell for sure if it's hit the turf...remember, there has to be conclusive evidence of the ball touching grass. And there isn't conclusive evidence. The screen flashes out and India have a second. Nicely lured by Ashwin, that drifted in and forced him to play unlike the last one which he had left. Powell not too happy with the decision. But going by the rules in such cases, that is the correct decision.
swings in and lands at yorker length just outside off. Stabbed into the covers
length ball wide outside off, skids in as he lets it go. Didn't pick that one
flies past slip this time. Hetmyer pokes away from the body on the front foot and he isn't to the pitch of the ball. Dips, spins, takes the edge but safe for the batsman in the end
classy. Length ball on middle and leg and he offers the full face and a high elbow as he punches this past the stumps at the other end
punched back down the pitch again and Umesh picks up and chucks it back to hit the stumps at the other end. It deflects into the covers but they won't take a run

beautiful. That is sensational. Length ball in the corridor and his feet have put him in a great position as he brings the bat down on it from right behind - no angle - and punches it on the up. Gets it wide of mid-off
length on the pads, flicks it through square leg from deep in the crease
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket on the up
length ball shaping away outside off, leaves it alone
length ball skidding in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at off stump, pushed into the covers
full and drifting in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and skidding down leg side, can't get bat on it. Cops it on the thigh
short of a length on off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and shaping away outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and in at leg stump, defneded solidly down the pitch
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball in the corridor, blocked solidly on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to mid-on with a closed face
full on off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
short of a length and ripping away outside off, backs away for the cut and is beaten
length and skidding in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked off the inside half of the bat
length on off stump, big stride forward to defend this
length on middle stump, big stride again and he sweeps to long leg's left
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and in at leg stump. Gets on the back foot and jabs it wide of short leg
length on middle stump and turning away. Dead-batted on the front foot
beats the outside edge. That turns too much. Length outside off and he presses away from the body
googly dropped short of a length on leg stump. Gets back and whips it to long leg
looped up on leg stump, punched to long-on
length on off stump and sliding across. Defended on the front foot off the outside half
length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to deep point
full on off stump, flicked back down the pitch
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full ball drifted down leg side. Gets on top of it and swats it fine with a sweep
full on leg stump, driven firmly against the turn to mid-on's right
length on off stump, steps out and dead-bats it after being beaten in flight
nicely played. Full ball on leg stump, gets down the pitch to meet it at shin height and punch it wide of mid-on
full on middle stump, steps out and drives back to the bowler
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, leans in and drives against the turn. Pujara chases from extra cover and puts in a slide
full toss on off stump, punched off the front foot to mid-off
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at leg stump, driven with the turn to long-on
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
more glorious driving from Hope. Nice flex of the front leg to meet this at the pitch and cut out any turn outside off and then a flowing drive to get it wide of mid-off
length ball outside off, jumps up as he looks to block on the front foot and gets him on the forearm
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

taken at point! Oh Hetmyer. It's a repeat performance of the last match. Chucks his bat across the line of one that spins away from him on off stump. It's an ugly heave. Off the edge and straight to point. Just when it looked like he had figured out the spinners, he manufactures a wicket of his own. That's Kuldeep's tenth wicket of the series. West Indies have lost three wickets without erasing the deficit
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

guides it straight to slip! West Indies crumbling and their most solid batsman on the day is gone. Jadeja hits the same line on off stump, but he pulls the length back a touch and this allows the ball to turn. Hope follows with his hands and opens the face as it spins away. Rahane with a comfortable catch to his right
length ball in at leg stump. It slides straight through and catches him on the pad
length on off stump, blocked off the front foot
length ball turning away outside off. Dead-batted into the off side
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and turning away. Tapped to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length on off stump, gets back in the crease and flicks to square leg
short of a length and pushed through, tucked to square leg off the inside half
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
length outside off, blocked on off stump
full on leg stump, flicked fine to deep square's right
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra cover
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side
full on off stump, driven to short extra
length on leg stump, flicked to short leg off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket
length on leg stump, tucks it neatly behind square on the off side
tossed up at off stump, nice flowing drive to mid-off's left
short of a length on leg stump, tapped between deep square and deep backward square
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten. Length outside off, a flail on the front foot and he can't get bat on it
length on off stump, driven to short extra
side-arm and sliding in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
full outside off, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
full on off stump, comes in with the angle and gets the inside half of the bat as he defends with a gap between bat and pad
short ball down leg side, past the bat
length ball curving in at off stump. Defended with hard hands into the covers
length on middle stump, shoveled to deep square off the front foot
length ball in at off stump. Straightens after pitching. Defended into the covers
length on leg stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length on leg stump, gets on his toes and flicks straight to the fielder close at square leg
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
big appeal from Jadeja as this hits the front pad and deflects onto Pant's helmet grille. It was an arm ball that skid past the inside edge. They won't review it. Impact was outside anyway
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch
short of a length outside off, rises steeply as he lets it go
length on the pads, deflected to the keeper
length on leg stump, flicked on the rise to square leg
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full inswinger at middle stump, hurriedly driven back at the bowler on the bounce
bouncer dug in a bit too short. Chase ducks under it
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
length and in at middle and off. Pushed down the pitch
wide of the crease, angled in at off stump. Defended solidly on the front foot
length outside off, defended to short extra
full outside off, jammed down to long-off
length and in at middle stump, blocked down the pitch
length ball in the corridor, rises up steeply as he looks to defend on the front foot
nicely played. This short ball angles down leg side and he swivels vociferously to keep the hook down and well fine of the long leg fielder
raps the thigh guard after swinging in late. Extra bounce too. He was looking to flick and was struck in front of leg stump
lifts up again. Not a bad bowling surface before going to Australia. Bangs it in on a length and gets it to cut back in. Inside edge onto thigh guard
deftly done. Length and hooping in at leg stump. Stood firm and tickled it fine
full and in at middle stump. Driven to the non-striker's left where Jadeja slides and chucks from the floor
tossed up full on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up at middle stump, driven with the turn to long-on
length on leg stump, driven past the bowler
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicks to short midwicket's right where Kohli dives to stop and breaks a lot of afternoon naps at the stadium
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball outside off, stabs to deep point with an open face
full and in at middle stump. Driven off the toe-end to mid-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full and in at middle stump, punched back to the bowler off the front foot
bouncer on middle stump, swivels and hooks to deep square

bowled off the pad! That big inswinger does it again. Chase looks to defend a middle and off stump line. It pings off the inside edge, hits the thigh guard and knocks out off stump. Yadav really using that inswinger well today. Eighth wicket of the game for him
short of a length  on off, tapped into the off side
length on off stump, driven against the turn to extra cover
full outside off, jabbed gently through cover
full and wide outside off, stretches a long way out and pads it to first slip
short of a length on leg stump, turned to short fine off the back foot
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot

another one off the pad! Another inswinger, and once again Umesh finds himself on a hat-trick! Dowrich with a short stride forward as this swings in outside off. He manages an inside edge too just like Chase. It hits off stump again off the pad
raps the pad but this is going down leg side. It's full and angled in at leg stump. He looks to flick but won't get bat on that. Trickles out to fine leg
inside edge to square leg. Looks to defend against an inswinger outside off
short of a length just outside off, lifts up and gets him on the glove as he looks to cut this
full inswinger down leg side, waits on it to arrive and tickles it fine
length and wide outside off, left alone
slow turn from middle and leg, tucked to fine leg for an easy single.
firm drive as he gets to the pitch of the ball, can't beat mid-off.
too short, breaks back in from outside off, Holder works this to square leg.
goes right back and across as he defends with the spin.
cleverly done, waits for the turn, makes a bit of room and guides this behind point. Slow turn gave him time to adjust. This was bowled at just 74kph
turn from length on middle and leg, defended.
short of length on off, dabbed gently into the off side.
full, late reverse in from outside off, pushed to cover
steered down to square third man, there's no one there and this was a very safe shot because the intention was to always keep this along the ground. Ambris has looked very impressive so far.
beauty! Excellent comeback. Zippy length ball that hits a spot and takes off to beat Ambris's tentative poke. Pant takes it close to his face.
works this with the angle to deep square leg.
deflects this behind square on the off side

enticed into the drive as he sees the flight, goes hard at the drive but is beaten and the bat ends up grazing the turf. What's happened here? Kohli reviews. There's some dust that comes off the turf as well and ultra edge confirms there was no spike. Almost as if Kohli thought 'anyway I have reviews, let me use one of them here.'
worked with the spin to long-on
gets a long way forward and defends with the bat close to his pad
swung away superbly over wide long-on. Used his height and reach to get to the pitch and sweep this all with the spin. Terrific swing
squeezes this drive back past the bowler, towards mid-off.
fired full on off, he lunges forward and defends.
late movement in, he gets outside the line and defends. This rolls off an inside edge to the leg side.
gets forward and defends this length ball gently into the off side.
tickled past the diving Rishabh Pant, races to the fine leg boundary. Umesh started from middle, finished way down leg and Ambris simply lent direction to the delivery
confident forward stride as he drives to mid-off
late movement back in, Ambris plays across the line when he should've been looking mid-on. Somehow manages to get an inside edge onto the pad.
hustled for pace as he hops back and buns this to the leg side.
googly that drifts away from over the wicket, Holder gets to the pitch of the ball and defends.
sharp turn back into middle and leg, Holder goes back and across to keep that out
uppish but lands short of Kuldeep. Holder was looking to play this to long-on
googly that pitches miles outside leg, Holder picks it, also the turn is very slow so he has time to adjust and defend.

gets right to the pitch as he drills this extra cover drive. The length was judged so very quickly. Didn't matter that he was driving against the spin because he used his reach very nicely. Class batting, too good to be batting at No. 8 really.
eased to long off as he jogs the single
free-flowing straight drive but mid-on intercepts that
uppish but rolls safely into the gully region. Holder surprised by the bounce that time
right behind the line as he defends this length ball back.
struck on the pad, big appeal but this was comfortably missing leg. Came back in a long way though.
gets the bat well in front of the pad as he squirts this late inswinging delivery into the off side.
steered nicely down to square third man
worked with the spin
drifts away one at length, he makes a bit of room and defends.
reaches out to ease this back to the bowler.
waits for the turn and then defends this into the leg side
flatter one on middle, he goes back and across to pat this
googly which he didn't read off the hand, jabbed it away safely in the end.
flatter one drifting into middle and leg, defended
slides back in to hit the thigh pad as it beat the inside edge
eased with the spin to sweeper cover
fully forward as he smothers this tossed up delivery to the off side
right to the pitch of the ball, as if he's smelling leather, as he blocks.
defends with the bat well in front of the pad again.
accurate again, length on the stumps, defended.
half a lunge forward as he defends.
freeflowing drive to long-off as they jog the single
this is a beauty! Googly that he didn't read. Drifted away and beat his forward prod as he played down the wrong line. Superb
much closer to the pitch of the ball as he turns it to the leg side
well forward as he smothers this full delivery.
fired into middle and leg, defended into the leg side
quicker one hurled in from wide of the crease, eased back
driven inside out but straight to Shaw at cover
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks
right forward as he smothers this.

has he got him? There's a big appeal, not given. Fizz and turn for Jadeja. Ian Gould not convinced, Holder doesn't seem worried. India have reviewed. Holder prods forward to defend but is beaten by the bite off the pitch. Did it kiss the edge or not is the question. Yes, ultraedge confirms a spike, so there was a very faint nick, enough for the third umpire to over-turn the onfield decision and Holder is gone! Pant fumbled just a bit but managed to hold on.
defended from the crease.
sharp turn but Ambris is solid in defence
